intro: Dinosperma stipitata, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods that aid in wind dispersal. Its root system is deep and drought-resistant, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Dinosperma stipitata is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some cultures for its anti-inflammatory and detoxifying effects.
